intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium simia subsp. subincertum, commonly known as the uncertain monkey's head, is a member of the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive yellow-orange flower heads, which resemble a monkey's face. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. Its leaves are usually hairy and have a rough texture. It is a perennial herb that can be found in parts of Europe and western Asia.
